fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49933].
  {panel}

We recently updated our Confluence license from 25 users to 50 users.  However, we didn't update our Team Calendars license.

Team Calendars reported the following error message: _"Team Calendars Plugin's license allows for only 25 active users, but there are 25 of them in Confluence."_

As you can see, this error message isn't helpful.

The real reason for the error is that our Team Calendars license is only for 25 users, but our Confluence license is for 50 users.
fields.summary: Meaningless error message when licensing is incorrect

  {panel}

Hello

I just added a team members leave in the new calendar, I got a call from him telling me that he was on vacation that day so he could not come to my "meeting"

I asked him to forward the email to me and there was nowhere to be seen that is was a "leave" type event. Something to add? Please?

Kind Regards
/Henric

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49903].
  {panel}

When attempting to display a Team Calendar in a deck of cards the Team Calendar is not displayed if the deck of cards does not have the Calendar on the first card that is to be displayed. Attempting to interact with the calendar refreshes and the Calendar information will be displayed.

Contacted the Deck of Cards plugin vendor for resolution and the reported: "After much investigation, we found the Team Calendar does not show up in {localtab group} and {localtab} macros from Navitabs Plugin by bitvoodoo too. Other than that, from our findings Google Calendar macro is displaying fine in any cards of deck.
Thus, we suspect the issue comes from Team Calendar Plugin itself, which is not compatible in tabs. Perhaps you may get proper assistance from its developers here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars#support"

Please investigate and provide a resolution.
fields.summary: Team Calendars to not display when not on first card in a deck of cards

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49898].
  {panel}

Precondition
* Verify on firefox 28.0
* Login to Confluence successfully

Steps:
* Click on *Add Calendar* button
* Click on *Subscribe by URL* button
* Observe header of Subscribe popup

Actual:
* The "Help" link does not show properly

!Screen Shot 2014-04-07 at 4.46.58 PM.png|thumbnail!

Expected:
* The "Help" link shows properly like another browsers

!Screen Shot 2014-04-07 at 5.13.55 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.summary: Getting a 500 error when trying to add/view events in Team Calendars
Usernames in Team Calendar's restrictions are not case insensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49892].
  {panel}

This is probably a very rare use case, but [~dluong] noticed it while testing:

1. Import an ical file to create a new calendar in TC.
2. Import the same ical file again to create another calendar in TC.
3. Now drag an event from the first calendar in week or month view.
4. Notice that the corresponding event from the second calendar is also moved.
fields.summary: If two copies of the same ical file are imported then dragging an event from one calendar will also move the corresponding event from the other calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49890].
  {panel}

This seems to be related to existing issues:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1854
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1196
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1285

There are two problems. One is that the events rearrange as your scroll horizontally. This might be considered a matter of preference and is not necessarily a bug. The other problem is that events are not stacked properly, they overlap each other and events are obscured. This is clearly a bug and it makes the timeline view unreliable and therefore unusable.

This calendar of my exhibits the problem:

https://amplify-jira.atlassian.net/wiki/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=5e68abb4-765b-4ca0-8c58-0049e9cdba27

Create a new Calendar in Team Calendars based on JQL.


This works: 
fixversion = earliestUnreleasedVersion() and project in (CRM, EDVCM)

but this does not work:
fixversion = earliestUnreleasedVersion() and category = Echo

The filter above returns results in JIRA, but for some reason is not pulling issues into Team Calendars.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49881].
  {panel}

When [subscribing Confluence Team Calendar in Microsoft Outlook|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Team+Calendars+from+Microsoft+Outlook], the event is displayed without reflecting timezone difference.

h6. Steps to Replicate
# Login using _User A_ with [timezone setting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+User+Settings] GMT+8
# Create a new calendar named *Meeting List* with timezone GMT+8
# Create a new event named *Night Meeting* for '<Today's Date> 20:00 until 21:00'
# Login using _User B_ with timezone GMT+6 (use a PC with timezone GMT+6)
# Add existing calendar *Meeting List*
# *Night Meeting* event will be shown as '<Today's Date> 18:00 until 19:00'
# Subscribe to *Meeting List* calendar to get the ICS Link for Microsoft Outlook
# Open Microsoft Outlook and [subscribe to Confluence Team Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Team+Calendars+from+Microsoft+Outlook] by using the ICS Link in the previous step
# In Microsoft Outlook, *Night Meeting* is still displayed as '<Today's Date> 20:00 until 21:00'. It should be displayed as *'<Today's Date> 18:00 until 19:00'*
fields.summary: Event Time doesn't Follow Timezone Difference in Microsoft Outlook

This is with confluence 4.2.5.

To reproduce:

* Add an Active Directory integration for confluence... Read Only, with Local Groups
* Try to add one of the users who hasn't logged in as the "Who" for a People calendar.

You will get an error: "Please select a valid user"

It should instead accept this as a valid user.

There is a similar behavior in Confluence out-of-box.  When trying to add one of these users to project security screen, auto-complete doesn't work. It still accepts a username that is hand entered though.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49820].
  {panel}

Hi,
I have multiple calendars in confluence experiencing this issue. A user subscribes to a calendar and syncs it with Outlook. Not all events are synced and some events are overlapped. User reports multiple time zone errors in Outlook.

We are starting to bring this plugin to our production server full time and alot of people are running into this issue when syncing PTO calendars and On Call calendars.  Would love a bump in this one needing this issue fixed ASAP.

Please fix this one soon! This is what I am seeing in Outlook: https://answers.atlassian.com/upfiles/error_18.png


This is a huge blocker because a lot of people rely on the sync between Outlook and team calendars.

# [Subscribe to a calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Google+Calendars+From+Confluence]

h3. Workaround
This is likely caused by corrupt calendar subscriptions. For Team Cal 4.2 and above the instructions to fix are below.
# First, make a full backup of the database just in case anything goes wrong
# Run this query to remove duplicate calendar subsriptions for the affected user (this will not remove calendars that the user has created, but the user may need to re-add some calendars to their calendar view.
{code}
select id, description from AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS 
 where creator = (select user_key from user_mapping where username = 'the-username') 
 and parent_id is not null
  group by id having count(description) > 1;

delete from AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS where if in (the ids from step 1);
{code}
# Restart Confluence
# If this doesn't resolve the issue, you can run this query to delete *all* calendar subscriptions for the user. Again, this will not delete any calendars that the user has created, but they will need to re-add all their calendars to their calendar view.
{code}
delete from AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS 
 where creator = (select user_key from user_mapping where username = 'the-username') 
 and parent_id is not null;
{code}
# Restart again

If this doesn't resolve the issue please raise a Support request at https://support.atlassian.com so we can help you out.
fields.summary: Error 500 - subcalendar
Team Calendars not communicating with Google Apps calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49805].
  {panel}

*Precondition*
* Login to confluence successfully
* There are some calendars and sub calendars

*Steps*
* Click to edit a sub calendar
* => it shows edit dialog
* Edit calendar name then click OK button
* => The calendar name was changed and the edit dialog was closed (it's good)
* Click to edit a sub calendar
* Edit calendar name then click CANCEL button

*Actual*
* The context menu does not close

*Expected*
* The context menu does not close

_Notes_
* _Please take a look at attached video for more detail_
fields.summary: [IE8] The context menu does not close after cancel edit Sub calendar dialog
Subscribe and export options still shown in calendar drop down when you don't have view permissions for a calendar
Duplicate license required
Checkbox labels for custom checkboxes are broken in event macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49797].
  {panel}

h3. Step to reproduce.
Try to edit an team calendar event with IE8 browser.

h3.Observed result.
The edit box appear and disappear almost immediately.

*Extra Note*
When user click the team calendar event in IE8 browser, sometimes the edit box appear and dissapear almost immediately therefore user is unable to edit.

Sometimes, trying to edit team calendar event in IE8 will cause the CPU usage of the IE8 to drastically increase. Both of this issue occur in client side browser and machine.
fields.summary: Unable to edit team calendar  event in IE8
Team Calendars javascript error with older UPM versions
Unable to delete two calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49784].
  {panel}

If you have a project where it's key it's either LESS, MORE, AUDIT, ABORT and possibly many other JQL [Restricted Words|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-ReservedWords] (I've tested with the ones referred, don't have time to test all of them), you get an error. 

*Steps to reproduce:*

1 - Create a project in JIRA that has MORE as they project key.
2 - Go to Confluence Team Calendars and try to create a JIRA Calendar that has the project you've just created.
3 - Get the error:
{quote}*Error occurred while validating project against [JIRA (example.atlassian.net)].*{quote}

This seems to be related to [TEAMCAL-496|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-496].
fields.summary: Cannot add JIRA calendars if JIRA's Project Key is equal to a JQL restricted word.
Upcoming events on dashboard should be below "Getting started" (regression)
In the time line view, the event label is only visible when the start of the event is visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49768].
  {panel}

On any Ondemand instance, Team Calendars can't be edited. When clicking on Edit, nothing happens. There is no way of removing subcalendars of the macro. 

*Notes:*
* it was working properly on previous OnDemand release
* this other issue was worked on regarding the same problem but on a future release: [TEAMCAL-2129|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-2129]

*Workaround:*
# Remove the Calendar
# Save the page
# Create a new Calendar and add the subcalendars needed.
Also, subcalendars can be deselected after saving the page.

fields.summary: Icon for events calendar has a strange underline

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49766].
  {panel}

Precondition
* Setup *Application Links * with trusted mode

Steps:
* Go to My calendars then create an event, select event type is JIRA Agile Sprints

Actual:
* *Create event* popup shows error message "401 - Unauthorized"

Expected:
* User able to create Jira issue

 *Notes:*
* User able to create a JIRA table in a page with Trusted mode
* User able to create a JIRA issue with OAuth mode

fields.summary: User unable to create JIRA issue when Application Links is Trusted mode
Event summaries overflow the containing lozenges in printed week view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49762].
  {panel}

Team Calendar restrictions do not apply if the calendar is in a Calendar Macro withing a Confluence page.

+Repro steps:+
# Create a calendar.
# Restrict it to one group.
# Create a Confluence page with a calendar macro containing the restricted Calendar.
# View the page with a user with no permissions to see the calendar.

This bug affects new calendars and also existing calendars after the upgrade to Team Calendar 4.2+.
fields.summary: Restrictions do not apply in calendar macro
Notification not working for event types "Leave", "Travel" and "Birthdays"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49758].
  {panel}

Events are added through Jira.  Jira Issue calendar events are created through Team Calendars.  Some Jira event show up, some do not.  We have waited almost one full day between checking events.
The JQL we are using finds the events in Jira, but nothing shows up in the Team Calendars.
Additionally, some members of the team are seeing event prior to the events being updated, even after a refresh.  This leads to two different people viewing the same calendar and seeing different results, even after refreshing both screens.  Perhaps these two errors are related.
This is blocking our use of this (paid) feature.
fields.summary: New events do not show up in calendars; different users see different events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49757].
  {panel}

Team, I just [got a customer|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-116689] that was pretty confuse on how to update his TC calendar, so I decided to create a KB:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=440599109

However it was moved to another space. So, my suggestion is to add a step-by-step way on how to update TC license here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Licensing+and+Installing+Team+Calendars

(!) PS: After talking with A.Campbell, he suggested to add [~rrobins] in this thread.
fields.summary: Suggestion to add to the TC Licensing and Installing Team Calendars doc
Team Calendar cannot be edited by a user who have permission
Performance - Popular Team Calendar view is very slow
Due date calculation error
Unable to click and drag event items in week mode
Event name is not saved, calendar name is always taken
Using 300 MB of heap
Cannot create a Jira calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49728].
  {panel}

Hello, 

we just have bought Tema Calendars, and we are very disappointed. 
We need to see our JIRA issues in a Calendar, but we have a big problem.
It only show issues if I mark the option "Creation Date".

It don't work if i want to show by another date type, like "resolution date" or my date fields.

I think the problem exists with date (not datetime) fields.

Please, resolve it as soon as posible. It's a big bug and it's possible that we will return you the product, requiring a money back.
fields.summary: Team Calendar don't work fine with dates
Calendars unable to locate users for Create Event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49721].
  {panel}

Was using Team Calendars v3.0.0 in Confluence v4.3.5 and just updated the plugin to version v4.1.4 and now the plugin won't enable.  Error messages says "This plugin failed to enable.  Your license may be invalid. Please refer to the logs for more information."  

I can't find anything in the logs, but maybe I'm not looking at the right log?  
license is valid until July 22, 2014.

We have a big team that keeps leaves and events updated on our confluence space and this is keeping people from being able to update it or see who is unavailable...
fields.summary: Upgraded Team Calendars Plugin from 3.0.0 to 4.1.4 in Confluence 4.3.5 and it won't enable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49720].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new calendar
# Create two different events with the following start and end dates:
#* Event 1: March 11 to April 26
#* Event 2: March 11 to June 28
# Switch to Timeline view and try to zoom in (until full) and out a number of times

h4. Expected Results
The two events (Event 1 and 2) should be shown even though the timeline is zoomed in/out because they are placed in the same starting date

h4. Actual Results
When the timeline is not zoomed, the two events are shown:
!screenshot1.jpg!

When zooming in, only one event is shown:

!screenshot2.jpg!

However, both events start at the same day so both of them need to be shown in the timeline

h4. Environment Information
Confluence 5.0 and Team Calendars 3.1.3
fields.summary: Timeline does not show some events when zooming in
Icon missing from Insert menu macro
The "get started" button didn't work
No user feedback when a connection at an external calendar subscription fails. Also logs are spammed.
